description.value:
Trigger A creature reaches the Granite Ox's head or attempts a skill check to disable the hazard

Effect The Granite Ox tosses its head. Creatures in the area @Damage[(2d12+13)[bludgeoning]] damage must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] saving throw. The hazard rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone].

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and takes @Damage[1d12[persistent,bleed]] damage as it scrapes across the Ox's scales.

details.description: The head of the Granite Ox tosses back and forth as the creature charges toward Dhuraxilis.
details.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:27] (master) to tug one of the ox's ears, @Check[arcana|dc:32], @Check[nature|dc:32], @Check[occultism|dc:32], or @Check[religion|dc:32] (expert) to distract the Ox with a display of magic, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:35] (expert) to dangle in front of the Ox's eyes and obscure its vision; three successes are required to disable the hazard
details.reset: The hazard ends automatically after 5 rounds or once all PCs are thrown from the Ox's back, whichever comes first.
details.routine: (1 action) The Granite Ox bucks. Each creature on the Ox's head must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:33] save. Prone creatures gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the save. On a failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone]. On a critical failure, the creature flies from the Ox's back, falling 120 feet to the ground or into Kardaji Bay.
